p: Under the 2070-CCSM RCP 8.5 scenario, the area of potential habitats of Davidia involucrata would be reduced (up to 59.1%; Fig. 8B and Table 1), and such losses would mainly occur in south-central China. In contrast, there would be a slight area extension in the western margin of its current potential habitats in southwestern China; in the East Himalayas, there would be both gains and losses of potential habitats. The area overlapping with the present potential habitats is still high (about 75%; Fig. 8C and Table 1). The suitable habitats with high probability (0.5â€“1) would account for only 36.5% of all the area of potential habitats (thresholds-1) ( Table 1).
